title: Grok AI Stops Making Revealing Pictures Where It's Against the Law
summary: Grok is an AI chatbot made by Elon Musk's company. It can edit photos to make people look like they are wearing less clothing, such as bikinis or underwear. This has caused problems because some people made inappropriate pictures without permission, especially of women and children. Many countries like Malaysia, Indonesia, and the Philippines got upset and blocked Grok or are planning to. California in the U.S. is also looking into it. Now, X, the company that owns Grok, says it will stop this feature in places where it is illegal. They are using technology to block it. However, some people found that the tool still works in some areas. This shows that companies need to follow laws and protect people from harmful content online.

background_read: AI chatbots like Grok are computer programs that can talk to people and do tasks like editing photos. Sometimes, they can be used in ways that hurt others, such as making inappropriate pictures without asking. Laws in different countries help protect people from this. Companies need to follow these laws to keep everyone safe online. This article talks about how Grok is changing to stop breaking laws in places where it is illegal to make revealing pictures.
